snippet: The organization said that it believed it had not violated antitrust laws and that it was seeking clarification on details of the decision, such as the notion of trust funds for athletes.
abstract: NCAA announces plans to appeal ruling in the so-called O’Bannon case, in which a federal judge took the legs out from under most justifications for the amateur model and kicked the billion-dollar college sports industry further down the road to professionalization than anyone before her ever has.
lead_paragraph: The organization said that it believed it had not violated antitrust laws and that it was seeking clarification on details of the decision, such as the notion of trust funds for athletes.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Will Appeal the O’Bannon Ruling
headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. Will Appeal the O’Bannon Ruling
